intro: Lepismium megalanthum, commonly known as the giant lepismium, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, often found on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. Lepismium megalanthum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts for its unique appearance.
